CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He has been recognised as falling within Category I disabled status ( the gravest CARDINAL ) on account of his service during the Second World War .
CARDINAL . The applicant was an operative who dealt with the consequences of the GPE disaster . From DATE he was on a special priority list of persons to be allocated an apartment by the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG to provide the applicant with an apartment in accordance with the requirements of section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Chernobyl Victims ' Status and Social Security Act ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . This decision became final . Enforcement proceedings were commenced on DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , in DATE the bailiff requested from ORG replacement of the in - kind award conferred by the decision of DATE with an equivalent amount of money . On DATE the court dismissed that request . The court 's reasoning is unknown , as neither the party furnished a copy of that decision . ORG appealed and the proceedings are apparently still pending before ORG .

CARDINAL . Although the debtor was fined several times by the bailiffs , the decision of CARDINAL DATE has not been enforced . On several occasions , in their replies to the relevant applicant 's complaints , the ORG authorities gave explanations based on a lack of funds in the budget to purchase or construct new apartments and the lack of available apartments . The enforcement proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he lives in a rented house in poor living conditions ( for example , without water supply ) . The local press described the house as “ old ” and “ ramshackle ” .
CARDINAL . The general provisions of domestic legislation on enforcement of judicial decisions are set out in the judgment of DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Under LAW of LAW the bailiff is entitled to request proprio motu the relevant court to change the means of enforcement of a court decision if there are circumstances which preclude its enforcement by the means specified in that decision .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Chernobyl Victims ' Status and Social Security Act ( adopted on CARDINAL DATE ) provides , inter alia , that the entitled persons must be housed within DATE of the date of their relevant application . Construction of houses shall be funded from the ORG budget .
